Hypotheses and Specific Predictions: Day of year at which 25\% of growth is achieved ($DOY_{25}$) is negatively correlated with early spring T.
Day of year at which 50\% of growth is achieved ($DOY_{50}$)  is negatively correlated with early spring T.
Day of year at which 75\% of growth is achieved ($DOY_{75}$)  is negatively correlated with early spring T.
Day of year of max growth rate ($DOY_{ip}$) is negatively correlated with early spring T.
Peak growing season length ($L_{PGS} =DOY_{75} -DOY_{25}$) is positively correlated with early spring T.
Max growth rate ($g_{max}$) is independent of early spring T.
Annual growth ($\Delta DBH$; dendrobands) is positively correlated with early spring T.
On the centennial time scale, $\Delta DBH$ (from tree-rings) is positively correlated with early spring T.
